original: EWOKTH, Evert A:son, Civilingenjör, Direktör, Sthlm, f Sthlm 13/5 84 av dir Leonhard Anderson o Lotten Sandberg, gm Elsa Bergsjö. Maskiningex KTH 07. Anst Bergsunds mek verkst 07—08, olika el ind.föret i Tyskl 08—10, Ludwigsbergs verkst AB Sthlm 10— 14, dir.ass AB Kuntze & Co Sthlm 15—16, omb.m Sv metallmanuf.frn 17—18, dir.ass AB Arvid Böhlmarks Lampfabrik 18—22, vkst dir sed. 22. Ordf Sv el armaturfabr.frn. styr.led Sv elind.frn, Sv frn f ljuskultur, rev Sv ind.-frb, Sv verkst.frn, Fera mfl, flm Sthlms fabr.-frn. V. ordf Sthlms borgargille, en av bor-gersk 50 äldste, grshdlssoc deput i Sthlm, dep bemedl.komiss. Studieres Tyskl o Schweiz 10, div aff.res i fi länd. RVO.
translated: EWOKTH, Evert A:son, Civil Engineer, Director, Stockholm, b. Stockholm 13/5 1884, son of Director Leonhard Anderson and Lotten Sandberg, m. Elsa Bergsjö. Mechanical Engineering degree from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) 1907. Employed at Bergsunds Mechanical Workshop 1907-1908, various electrical industry companies in Germany 1908-1910, Ludwigsbergs Workshop AB Stockholm 1910-1914, assistant director of AB Kuntze & Co Stockholm 1915-1916, representative of Swedish Metal Manufacturing Company 1917-1918, assistant director of AB Arvid Böhlmarks Lamp Factory 1918-1922, plant director since 1922. Chairman of Swedish Electrical Fixture Manufacturing Company board, board member of Swedish Electrical Industry Association, Swedish Women's Lighting Culture Association, Swedish Industrial Association, Swedish Mechanical Workshop  Association, Fera Joint Stock Company, and Stockholm's Factory Association for Motion Pictures. Vice chairman of Stockholm's Citizen Guild, one of the 50 oldest citizens, deputy in the commercial chamber of Stockholm, deputy commissioner of the city's welfare commission. Studied in Germany and Switzerland in 1910, various business trips abroad. Awarded with the Royal Order of Vasa.

structured.name: Evert A:son Ewokth

memberOf.name: Stockholm's Factory Association for Motion Pictures

structured.description: Evert A:son Ewokth (1884-05-13 - ), a Swedish civil engineer and director, was born in Stockholm, Sweden. He is the son of Director Leonhard Anderson and Lotten Sandberg. Ewokth is married to Elsa Bergsjö. He obtained a degree in mechanical engineering in 1907 from the Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. Throughout his career, he worked for various organizations including Bergsunds Mechanical Workshop, Ludwigsbergs Workshop AB, AB Kuntze & Co, Swedish Metal Manufacturing Company, and AB Arvid Böhlmarks Lamp Factory. Ewokth has held several positions in different associations and boards related to the electrical, industrial, and mechanical sectors, such as the Swedish Electrical Fixture Manufacturing Company, Swedish Electrical Industry Association, Swedish Women's Lighting Culture Association, Swedish Industrial Association, Swedish Mechanical Workshop  Association, Fera Joint Stock Company, and Stockholm's Factory Association for Motion Pictures. He has also been involved in Stockholm's Citizen Guild as its Vice Chairman.

career.workplace: Various electrical industry companies in Germany
